title.narrative: Ethiopia Water Supply, Sanitation and Hygiene Project

description.narrative: The proposed development objective of the project is to “increase access to improved water supply and sanitation services for residents in participating woredas/towns and communities in Ethiopia.”

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Financing Agreement Reference: Schedule 2 | Description :Not later that one (1) month after the effectiveness ofthis Agreement, the Recipient shall develop a set of criteria, satisfactoryto the Association, to be used to determine financingmodalities (grant, loan, or the combination of the two) for the activities tobe implemented by WRDF under Part 2 of the Project. |Due Date :31-Oct-2014

Finance Agreement :Financing Agreement Reference: Schedule 2 | Description :The Recipient shall maintain at all times during theProject implementation period the National WaSH Steering Committee, the National WaSH Technical Team, the National WaSHCoordination Office, as well as WaSH Program Management Units in its sector ministries, all with the composition, terms ofreference and resources adequate for the Project implementation and satisfactory to the Association. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Financing Agreement Reference: Schedule 2 | Description :The Recipient shall monitor and evaluate the progressof the Project and prepare Project Reports in accordance with the provisions of Section 4.08 of the General Conditions of the F/Aand on the basis of the indicators acceptable to the Association. Each Project Report shall cover the period of 6 months, and shallbe furnished to the Association not later than 45 days after the end of the period. | Frequency :Semi-annual

Finance Agreement :Financing Agreement Reference: Schedule 2 | Description :The Recipient shall regularly review the effective useof SA, ESMF, RPF and Supplemental Social and Environmental Safeguard Instruments as part of the monitoring and evaluation systemforthe Project. | Frequency :Semi-annual

Finance Agreement :Financing Agreement Reference: Schedule 2 | Description :The Recipient shall, no later than July 7 of each yearuntil completion of the Project, carry out independent annual procurement audits of the Project activities, all in accordance withthe terms of reference agreed with the Association. The audited reports for each such period shall be furnished to the Associationnot later than four (4) months after the end of such period. | Frequency :Yearly
